gurmukhi: KVg isMG qb KVg gih Aiq icq kop bFwie ] sYn mlyCn kI hnI jmpur deI pTwie ]1609]
transliteration: Khadag Singh Tab Khadag Gadh At(i) Chit Kop Badhaae|| Sain Malechhan Kihanijampur Daipathe||1609||
translation: Then Kharag Singh holding his sword in ire, despatched the army of maleshhas to the abode of Yama.1609.

gurmukhi: doie CUhnI sYn jb mlyC kI niRp hnI ] Aaur suBt jy AYn cly nwm kib dyq kih ]1610]
transliteration: Doe Chhodhhanisin Jab Malechh Kinrip Hanee|| Aur Soubhat Je Ain Chle Naam Kabi Det Kah(i)||1610||
translation: When the king destroyed two extremely large units of the army of malechhas, then the remaining warriors who marched forward for war, their named are like this;1610.

gurmukhi: BIm gdw kir BIm lIey ieKuDI kit so kis pwrQ DwXo ] rwie juiDStr lY Dnu hwQ clXo icq mY Aiq kRoD bFwXo ]
transliteration: Bheem Gadaa Kar(i) Bheem Leee Ikhudhikattee So Kas(i) Paarath Dhaayo|| Raae Judhishtar Lai Dhan(u) Jetak San Houto Su Bulaayo||
translation: Bhima taking his mace and Arjuna tightening his waist with quiver marched forward; Yudhishtar carried his bow and arrows in his hands;

gurmukhi: BRwq blI doaU swQ lIey dlu jyqk sMg huqo su bulwXo ] AYsy iBry biRqrwsur isau mGvw iris kY ijm ju`Du mcwXo ]1611]
transliteration: Bhraat Balisooo Saath Leee Dal(u) Jetak San Houto Su Bhlaayo|| Aise Bire Britraasur Sio Maghvaa Ris(i) Kai Jim Juddh(u) Machadyo||1611||
translation: He took with him both the brothers and the army and began the fighting like Indra with Vratasura.1611.

gurmukhi: mn mih kop bFwie suBtn sBY sunwiekY ] KVg isMG smuhwie bcn khq BXo kiRSn isau ]1612]
transliteration: Man Maih Kop Bdhaae Soubhatan Sabhai Sounaae-kai|| Khadag Singh Samuhaae Bachanndkahat Bhyo Krishan Sio||1612||
translation: Getting infuriated in his mind, Kharag Singh went before Krishna and spoke with the hearing of all the warriors.1612.
Speech of Kharag Singh addressed to all the warriors:

gurmukhi: pscm sUr cVy kbhU Aru gMg bhI aultI jIA AwvY ] jyT ky mws qKwr pry bn Aaur bsMq smIr jrwvY ]
transliteration: Pascham Soor Chade Kab-hoo Ar(u) Gadg Bahiultijeea Aavai|| Jeth Ke Maas Takhaar Dare Ban Aur Basant Sameer Jaraavai||
translation: “Even if the sun rises from the west and the Ganges flows contrary to its course; even if it snows in the month of Jyeshth and the wind of spring gives scorching heat;

gurmukhi: lok hlY DRUA ko jl ko Ql huie Ql ko kbhU jlu jwvY ] kMcn ky ngu pMKn Dwir aufY KVgyS n pIT idKwvY ]1613]
transliteration: Lok Halai Dhrooa Ko Jal Ko Thal Hue Thal Ko Kab0hjal(u) Jeev ai|| Kanchanndke Nag(u) Pankhan Ddaar(i) Udai Khadgesh Na Peeth Dikhvai||1613||
translation: “Even if the stable pole star moves and if the waters turn into plain and plain into wates and if the Sumeru mountain flies with wings, Kharag Singh will never get back from the war-arena.1613.
